instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3437-B, full fan spin
threads.message:
Hello

This one has arrived with a complaint of intermittent shutdowns and the battery occasionally not holding power, with no signs of corrosion or prior work.

Everything works fine however I observed the following symptoms (all tested without battery)
- Continuous full fan spin
- When I get into diagnostic mode, it reports:
  1. There may be an issue with the SMC, reference: PFM006
  2. There may be an issue with the power management system, reference: PPN001, additional reference VFF001

I am a bit unsure where to start as the laptop comes up fine with no obvious issues other than above. Thermal sensor comes to mind, but not sure any of the above errors are related.

threads.title: 820-3437-B, full fan spin
threads.message:
First, test disconnecting the webcam.
If still the same, try known good trackpad board/flex.
LIO flex/board should be tested too, if problem persists.

threads.title: 820-3437-B, full fan spin
threads.message: Amazing ! It turned out to be the trackpad. Thanks a lot for the help.
